item.title: Lisa add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "you can tell the deepest truths with the lies of fiction" -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Say make me, remake me. You are free to do it and I am free to let you because look, look. Look where your hands are. Now." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jose Saramango
item.description: "We've all had our moments of weakness, and if we manage to get through today without any, we'll be sure to have some tomorrow." -- Jose Saramango

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "The thing about Tolkien, about <i>The Lord of the Rings</i>, is that it's perfect. It's this whole world, this whole process of immersion, this journey. It's not, I'm pretty sure, actually true, but that makes it more amazing, that someone could make it all up. Reading it changes everything." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "If you love books enough, books will love you back." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Patrick Rothfuss
item.description:
"Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.
First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing time, giving us distance from the things that have hurt us. When a person is wounded they will often fall unconscious. Similarly, someone who hears traumatic news will often swoon or faint. This is the mind's way of protecting itself from pain by stepping through the first door.
Second is the door of forgetting. Some wounds are too deep to heal, or too deep to heal quickly. In addition, many memories are simply painful, and there is no healing to be done. The saying 'time heals all wounds' is false. Time heals most wounds. The rest are hidden behind this door.
Third is the door of madness. There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. While this may not seem beneficial, it is. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain the mind must leave reality behind.
Last is the door of death. The final resort. Nothing can hurt us after we are dead, or so we have been told." -- Patrick Rothfuss

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Never try to outstubborn a cat." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A woman is not property, and husbands who think otherwise are living in a dreamworld." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Take big bites. Anything worth doing is worth overdoing." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Work is not an end in itself; there must always be time enough for love." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Science is magic that works." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "There is love enough in this world for everybody, if people will just look." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "You, Yunior, have a girlfriend named Alma, who has a long tender horse neck and a big Dominican ass that seems to exist in a fourth dimension beyond jeans. An ass that could drag the moon out of orbit. An ass she never liked until she met you. Ain't a day that passes that you don't want to press your face against that ass or bite the delicate sliding tendons of her neck. You love how she shivers when you bite, how she fights you with those arms that are so skinny they belong on an after-school special." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "And that's when I know it's over. As soon as you start thinking about the beginning, it's the end." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
item.description: "The belly is an ungrateful wretch, it never remembers past favors, it always wants more tomorrow." -- Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dom Helder Camara
item.description: "When I give food to the poor, they call me a saint. When I ask why the poor have no food, they call me a communist." -- Dom Helder Camara

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "An empty stomach is not a good political adviser." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mike Mullin
item.description: "Hunger of choice is a painful luxury; hunger of necessity is terrifying torture." -- Mike Mullin

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Criss Jami
item.description: "Feel what it's like to truly starve, and I guarantee that you'll forever think twice before wasting food." -- Criss Jami

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Frances Moore Lappe
item.description: "The real cause of hunger is the powerlessness of the poor to gain access to the resources they need to feed themselves." -- Frances Moore Lappe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jean-Bertrand Aristide
item.description: "We have not reached the consensus that to eat is a basic human right. This is an ethical crisis. This is a crisis of faith." -- Jean-Bertrand Aristide

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Janet Poppendieck
item.description: "By defining the problem as "hunger," the emergency food system is helping to direct our attention away from the more fundamental problem of poverty, and the even more basic problem of inequality." -- Janet Poppendieck

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dr. Norman Ernest Borlaug
item.description: "You can't build a peaceful world on empty stomachs and human misery." -- Dr. Norman Ernest Borlaug

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Earle Gray
item.description: "Most of the seven billion people in this world suffer from malnutrition. Half do not have enough to eat and the rest of us eat too much." -- Earle Gray
